Information Technology " Chinese Encoding Character Set
1 This document defines the Chinese graphics and characters and their binary codes in hexadecimal.
This standard applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other text, graphics, and character information.

This standard applies to technical products that have the function of processing and exchanging Chinese and other text graphics and characters information, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and braille writing, as well as portable products represented by computers, communication terminals, electronic books, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The following documents are incorporated by reference into this document as essential terms.
For dated references , only the version corresponding to that date is applicable to this document ; for undated references , the latest edition ( including all amendments ) applies to this document .
GB2312-1980 "Information Exchange Using Chinese Character Encoding Character Set" Basic Set
GB11383-1989 Information processing "Information exchange using eight-bit codes and coding rules
GB13000 Information technology — Universal multiple-octet coded character set (UCS)
3. Terms and definitions
The following definitions and abbreviations apply in this document .
3.1 Character character
an element of a collection of elements used for organization , control , or representation of data .
3.2 Encoded character
a character ( 3.1 ) and its encoding.
3.3 User-defined private use area
the user of a product that complies with this standard may define the area.
3.4. Vocabulary repertoire
a set of characters specified by a set of encoded characters (3.2) .
3.5 reserved zone
the scope of this document .
4 words
4.1 Overview
the characters in this file are encoded as single bytes , double bytes , or quad bytes .
The single byte part contains all 128 characters of GB11383-1989 0x00~0x7F.
4.3. Two-byte part
the double-byte part contains all the graphic characters in GB2312-1980 and the CJK unified characters in GB13000 as well as some graphic characters.
the characters in the two‐byte part are specified in Appendix A .
of which, the graphical, coding, and functional descriptions of the semantic text descriptor shall conform to the requirements of Appendix B.
Note: GB13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.

The Chinese characters with unique abstract characters are assigned a unique code position, while the Chinese characters with the same abstract characters but different origins are assigned a shared code position.
The Han Ideographs encoded are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4. Four-byte part

The four-byte section includes 66 CJK Unified Han characters (9FA6 一 9FEF, not including 9FB4~9FBB's 8 characters) and CJK Unified Han character extensions A, CJK Unified Han character extensions BCJK Unified Han character extensions C, CJK Unified Han character extensions DCJK Unified Han character extensions D, CJK Unified Han character extensions F,
the four-byte portion of the character is specified by Appendix C.
5 Overall Structure
In the text, any number preceded by 0x represents hexadecimal, and any number not preceded by 0x represents decimal.
all encoded representations are in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
the byte part uses the encoding structure of GB11383 1989, which uses the codes 0x00~0x7F.

The double-byte contribution part uses two eight-bit binary digits to represent a character, and the first byte code bit starts from 0x81 and ends with 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is 0x40 and 0x7E or 0x80 and 0xFE.
the four-byte part uses GB11383-1989, which does not adopt 0x30 0x39 as a suffix for double-byte encoding extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 0xFE39FE39.

The first byte of a four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third byte is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130

6.3. The order of arrangement of the characters of the four-character code

The 50,400 code points from 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39 correspond to all the characters in the Basic Multilingual Plane of GB13000 that are not included in the double-byte part, and are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in the Basic Multilingual Plane of GB13000.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 code points are used to map GB13000's 16 supplementary planes, and the character arrangement order is completely arranged according to the code point order of the corresponding supplementary planes of GB13000.
the order of the four @-@ byte characters shall be in accordance with Appendix C.

9.1 in general
This document defines three levels of implementation.
The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level should provide the full input/output function of all characters within the corresponding implementation level range.
9.2. Realization of Level 1

Implement level 1 encoding of the character in the text file, the seasonal encoding part, and the four-character compound encoding part of CJK Unified Hanzi (i.e., 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Hanzi Extended A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 to 0x823587
Any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements of level 1.
Note: In accordance with the requirements of software application, level 1 can also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese writing styles listed in Table 3.
level 2 includes level 1.
In addition, level 2 also encodes characters that are not combined in the General Standard Chinese Character Table level 1.
the code position and form of the Chinese characters included in the General Standard Chinese Character Table are shown in the appendix.
the operating system and support software must meet the requirements of level 2.

Note : System software and documentation software include but are not limited to operating systems , database management systems , and middleware ( see GB36475 for classification information on software products ) .
9.4. Realization level 3
level 3 includes level 2.
In addition, the level 3 document achieves all the Chinese characters and tables specified in the original document.
The products used for government services and public services should meet the requirements of level 3.

Note: The administrative services and shared service industries include but are not limited to railway transport, road transport, water transport, air transport, intermodal transport and transport agency, postal services, currency and financial services, insurance, land, management, health, national institutions, social security and other industries (industry classification information can be found in GB4754).

The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both use one or more of the four steps to process input files: preprocessing , compilation , assembly , and linking .
the file extension identifies the language of the source file , but the suffix controls the default setting for the compiler :
gcc thinks the preprocessed file (.i) is a c file and sets up a c-style link,
g++ thinks the preprocessed file (.i) is a C++ file and sets up the linkage in the C++ form.

especially the part about the preprocessor , but not the other effects of the -traditional option .
-fdollars-in-identifiers allows the use of `$' character in identifiers (only for C++).
you can specify the --no-dollars-in-identifiers option to make the prohibition of the $ symbol explicit.
(GNU C++ allows the `$' character by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversion from ant types to enumeration (enumeration) types (MEF c++).
Normally, GNU C++ allows a conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal---templates  generates smaller code for template declarations (template declarations only in C++) by creating a copy of each template function at the point of its definition.
To use this option successfully, you must mark #pragma implementation (definition) or #pragma interface (declaration) in all files that use the template.
when compiling the program with the option -fexternal-templates, all template instantiations are external types. You must make the instances you need appear in the implementation file.
this can be achieved with typedef , which references each instance that is required .
Correspondingly, if the compiler is used with the default option -fno-exteznal-templates, all template instantiations are explicitly set as built-in.
all member functions ( except constructors and mnew or delete member operators ) are considered virtual in the class in which they are declared .
this does not mean that every call to a member function goes through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly, and it does so.
-fcond-mismatch  allows the types of the second and third arguments of a conditional expression to mismatch.
the value of this expression is Void.-fthis-—is-variable  allows assignment to this (only in c++).
After the user-defined free storage management mechanism is merged into C++, the assignable `this' is inappropriate.
Therefore, by default, an assignment to this inside a member function is an invalid operation.
However, to be backwards compatible, you can make this operation effective by the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char  defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
All machines have their own default char types. It could be unsigned char or signed char.
In an ideal world, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char when relying on the symbolic meaning of data.
However, many programs have been written using only simple char, and it is assumed that this is an unsigned (or unsigned, depending on the target machine).
this option and its opposite option make such programs work on the corresponding default values.
the type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char , even if it is identical to one of them .
if no explicit signed or unsigned qualifier is present , these options define signed or unsigned bitfields .
By default, bitfields are signed, because they inherit the basic integer types, such as int, which are signed integers, but if the -traditional option is specified, bitfields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not treat them specially.
This is for compatibility with some old programs that count string constants as a very bad idea, and the -traditional option also has the same effect.
Executive Summary
The Impact of COVID-19 on the Illicit Drug Market
the impact could be similar to the 2008 financial crisis.
The global pandemic of COVID-19 has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

in many countries , the disease has overwhelmed health-care systems , brought them to the brink of collapse , and caused severe dislocations in the global economy as governments have tried to contain it .
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be significant.
some producers may be forced to find new ways to produce drugs because restrictions on mobility also limit access to precursors and basic chemicals .
smugglers may be forced to find new routes and methods because of travel restrictions .
the patterns of drug use and supply may change , and the government 's ability to respond may be impeded .
The changes brought by the new coronavirus are unprecedented, but we can still learn some lessons from previous crises.
after the 2008 economic crisis , some addicts began to seek cheaper synthetic substances and shifted to injecting drugs .
Meanwhile, governments have cut funding for drug-related programs.
if governments respond to the current recession in the same way , prevention efforts and services for substance abuse and related risk behaviors may be severely affected .
in addition , the priority given to interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced , making it easier for traffickers to operate .
Some countries have large quantities of drugs smuggled through commercial flights , and it is expected that the direct impact of these countries' drug trafficking activities will be the greatest.

couriers carry methamphetamine and other drugs in their carry-on bags or conceal them in their luggage . Sometimes the quantities are large . With almost all countries imposing restrictions on air travel , the commercial supply of drugs through air travel may be completely disrupted .
While international mail supply chains have been disrupted , activities that use the dark web and parcel delivery to sell goods may increase .
in the long term , economic recession and related measures may disrupt the drug market .

because of the rising unemployment rate and lack of opportunities , the poor and vulnerable populations are more likely to use drugs in a harmful way , become addicted to drugs , and engage in illegal activities related to drugs , whether it is production or transportation .
Drug trafficking organizations may exploit this situation by providing services to vulnerable populations and recruiting new members to bolster their ranks.
As government capacity declines, these changes may take root quickly and become the new reality for many communities.
Extensibility and Complexity
market growth
the demographic transition partially explains the market expansion
the global drug addiction phenomenon has been increasing, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the overall population.

In 2009, the estimated number of drug addicts was 210 million, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, while in 2018, the estimated number of drug addicts was 269 million, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
in the past 20 years , the growth rate of drug addiction in developing countries has been much faster than that in developed countries .

this reflects to some extent the differences in overall population growth over this period , with developed countries growing at 7 % , developing countries at 28 % , but also the fact that the population growth of young people in developing countries is faster .
adolescents and young adults are the most common demographic among drug users .
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group grew by 16% in developing countries, while it decreased by 10% in developed countries.
1. urbanization is a driving force for the current and future drug markets
In both developed and developing countries, the prevalence of drug addiction is higher in urban areas than in rural areas.

The overall increase in drug addiction is partly due to the massive population flow from rural areas to cities. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , especially in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced .

an increase in wealth is associated with an increase in drug use , but the burden of disease is borne most heavily by the poorest people worldwide , and drug use is more common in developed than in developing countries .
Cocaine and other drugs are more closely linked to wealthier parts of the world.
Similarly , within countries , drug use is more common among the socially affluent .
but the rate of addiction is high among people with lower socioeconomic status .
data from a few countries suggest a link between harmful smoking patterns and disease in low @-@ income populations .
these patterns seem less common in more affluent strata .
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable populations, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have historically been linked to increases in drug use, but this pandemic has already forced millions of people around the world to be unemployed.

COVID-19 may further expand the drug market, as the pandemic may lead to more farmers to engage in illicit cultivation, or due to the weakening control of the regulatory authorities, or due to more people being forced to engage in illegal activities in the face of economic crisis.

The related measures of COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land transportation, while sea transportation may have increased, as the risk of interception is low and the number of smuggling is more than that of air and land.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine is being smuggled directly from South America to Europe by sea.
complexity is enhanced
the availability of non @-@ controlled substances is stable , but new types of opioids with potential for harm are proliferating , and the drug market is becoming more complex .

in addition to the hundreds of synthetic drugs that have been added to the list of plant-based drugs such as marijuana , cocaine , and heroin , many of these drugs are not subject to international control.
The domestic market of member countries has about 500 new active substances every year.
currently , most of these are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a few opioids .
although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized , the proportions have changed .
Of the 150 new psychoactive substances (NPS) identified in 2014, only 2% were opioid-like, but by 2018, this had risen to 9%.

among the new psychoactive substances , many are fentanyl analogs , and their effects and risks have been documented , with overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere , albeit to a lesser degree .
in North America , fentanyl is used as an adulterant for heroin and other drugs ( including cocaine and methamphetamine ) , as well as for the production of counterfeit opioid analgesics .

some evidence suggests that injection of new psychoactive substances is also occurring in Europe : a study of residual syringes in six European cities found that many were contaminated with substances that produce a stimulant effect >
the use of new psychoactive substances may become increasingly entrenched in disadvantaged communities
a single type of new psychoactive substance has never formed a large market .
but evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among homeless and prison populations.
twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with synthetic cannabinoids being the main challenge in most countries .

The control of precursor chemicals has forced drug manufacturers to innovate, and many chemicals used to synthesize phenylacetone, methamphetamine, amphetamine and “ecstasy” have been placed under international control.

traffickers and manufacturers have been seeking alternatives to controlled substances , not only those that are less controlled , but also those specifically designed to evade control , namely , so @-@ called "designer precursors ."
restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of COVID @-19 are likely to further squeeze manufacturers of precursors used in the synthesis of illicit drugs .

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this has become a reality: Reports say that a shortage of methamphetamine precursor from East Asia in March 2020 caused the price of methamphetamine in Mexico and the US to rise.
the market is in a state of constant change.
synthetic opioids replace opium in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the heroin markets in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appear to have changed between 2008 and 2018 .
The number of opioids seized by the Russian federal authorities has dropped by about 80 percent, while the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has dropped significantly.
But the stimulant market seems to be thriving.
there is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones , including methcathinone and methylenedioxypyrovalerone , are readily available on the Russian drug market .
The Russian authorities reported that the number of secret laboratories manufacturing illicit drugs has surged recently, with a two-year increase of more than 100, reaching 152 in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq methamphetamine markets expand
an investigation of hospital , prison , and other personnel in 2012 had already revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq .
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern, in addition to fentanyl and tramadol.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with addicts reporting that marijuana was harder to obtain than "fenethylline" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine processing sites, and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about the large importation of preparations containing pseudoephedrine, which is used as a precursor in methamphetamine processing.
methamphetamine production began in Afghanistan in 2014 .
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing.
However, the seizure amount in the first half of 2019 was 1657 kg - a significant increase compared to the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine, believed to have originated in Afghanistan, have been seized in other countries, indicating that production is on the rise.
policy changes and trends
the legalization of marijuana for nonmedical use has been associated with increased marijuana use in many of its jurisdictions .
Canada, Uruguay and the United States' 11 jurisdictions allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
in most jurisdictions , cannabis use has increased since legalization , although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical use .

In the two states where marijuana was first legalized, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults using marijuana for nonmedical purposes has increased, especially in the past month and among those who use daily or almost daily, which has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that marijuana use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, and last month it almost doubled.
the increase was primarily due to frequent and regular use .
Canadian short-term data also shows that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, usage increased.
However , 40 % of cannabis users still obtained some products illegally in 2019 .
Is the decline in global cannabis herb seizures due to cannabis legalization?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb reached the lowest level in the past 20 years, because seizures in North America dropped by 84% over the past 10 years.

in contrast , seizures in other parts of the world nearly doubled during the same period . The seizure pattern suggests that policies intended to liberalize the marijuana market are having a key impact .

regulation of new psychoactive substances ( NPS ) appears to have had a dampening effect on the availability of NPS within the country , but the effectiveness of NPS regulation remains difficult to assess .
some countries with different regulatory systems for new psychoactive substances have shown different rates of use .
in some countries , the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after national legislation .

disadvantaged populations are disproportionately harmed by both legal and illicit opioid markets and are more likely to receive prescription opioids for pain management and palliative care in high @-@ income countries .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of all medical consumption of opioids were in high @-@ income countries .
About 50% are in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in the Pacific.
These countries account for about 12 percent of the world's population.
it is estimated that 88 % of the world 's population live in low - and middle - income countries , but they account for less than 10 % of global consumption of opioid analgesics .
barriers to obtaining prescription opioids are multifactorial , including legislation , culture , health system factors , and prescribing practices .
The risk of addiction is higher for the poor. In 2018, about 35.6 million people were addicted to drugs.

poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of addiction and worsen its consequences . evidence from high @-@ income countries suggests that these factors can also influence addiction risk through personal social @-@ economic trajectories , not just at a single point in time .

substance abuse disorders exacerbate social and economic disadvantage , further increasing the risks of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , and thus perpetuating the vicious cycle of disadvantage .

women , ethnic minorities , migrants , diverse sexual orientations , populations displaced by armed conflict or disaster , and rural populations are also disproportionately affected by opioid use disorders or have difficulty accessing treatment services .

according to the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) metric , which estimates the number of healthy years of life lost due to disability and premature death , the harmful effects of smoking on a broader range of society have intensified over the past decade .
Between 2007 and 2018 , the global disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ years lost due to smoking increased by 17 % .
the increase in life @-@ years lost from related comorbidities associated with untreated hepatitis C in injection @-@ drug users was particularly high , at 40 % .
the relationship between drug use and violence is complex and difficult to determine the causal relationship between all the factors of substance use and violence .
global data suggest that drunkenness may be an important factor in homicide .
but in violent events , alcohol seems to have a greater effect than drugs .

although drug use may be associated with criminality , in some cases this association can be partially attributed to multiple mediating factors , such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are influenced by personal risk , family environment , and peers .
the connections between drug trafficking and violence are multifaceted .
if there is a well-established criminal structure , including large-scale organized drug trafficking , such activities may be carried out peacefully .

in the short term , the level and degree of violence are more likely to be determined by the nature of the change that is destabilizing the power balance between organized criminal groups , such as changes in the size of the illicit market , the death or incarceration of prominent criminals , or law enforcement actions that make one group weaker than another .
the latest trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance , and opioids are the most harmful .
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
but the associated harms of opioids are often overlooked because of their relatively small user base .

in 2017 , an estimated 167,000 deaths were attributed to drug use disorders , with 66 % of those deaths due to these substances and 50 % of the 210 million years of life lost due to premature death or disability resulting from conditions believed to be caused by drug use .
Synthetic Opioid Misuse Worsens Public Health Crisis

in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa , the synthetic opioid crisis is driven by tramadol ; in North America , it is fentanyl . These regions have little in common economically , demographically , or in terms of general drug use patterns , but they are both struggling to combat a crisis fueled by the availability and low cost of substances that are easy to obtain and produce .
in North America , the use of synthetic opioids , such as fentanyl , has led to a surge in opioid overdose deaths over the past 20 years .
In 2018, fentanyl was involved in nearly two-thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths recorded in the United States.
Canada also reported similar results, with lower numbers.
one reason that fentanyl is involved in so many overdose deaths is that the potency of the drug on the illicit market is unpredictable .
the market for tramadol for nonmedical use has grown substantially in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa .
in that region , tramadol use by patients with pain is becoming more common .
In 2017 , the global seizure of tramadol increased significantly and reached a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law to regulate tramadol, global seizures fell to 3,200 tons.

the drivers of these crises are the simplicity of manufacture and the low cost of production , as well as the lack of international oversight of tramadol and many fentanyl analogs or their precursors .
the worsening of these crises is due to the fact that these substances are available on both the legal and illegal markets , making it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse .
the use of stimulants is on the rise .
the stimulant sector is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine , both of which are increasing in use in their main markets .
In 2018, about 19 million people used cocaine, because cocaine is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 27 million people used methamphetamine that year , with methamphetamine hydrochloride being the most commonly used methamphetamine in Southeast Asia and North America .
according to most indicators , methamphetamine use has been expanding in both regions for the past 2 decades .

in some markets , cocaine and methamphetamine coexist , sometimes substituting for each other , so that as the use of one drug rises , the use of the other falls , sometimes both drugs are used concurrently , with one drug being used to offset the other .
COVID-19 increases the risk of injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people inject drugs in 2018, and approximately 10 % of the global HIV infections are attributed to injecting drug use.
More than 100,000 people who inject drugs have HIV, and 5.5 million have Hepatitis C.
In 2017, approximately 585,000 people died of drug addiction, half of whom died of liver disease caused by hepatitis C, and most of the hepatitis C in intravenous drug users is still untreated.
shortages of opioids caused by COVID @-@ 19 restrictions may lead to users substituting with alcohol or benzodiazepines , which are easier to obtain , or mixing opioids with synthetic drugs .
with some users switching to injecting or injecting more frequently , there may be more harmful use .

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Officials: Refugee Process is Slowly Bottlenecked - China News
EU summit dominated by refugee policy disputes, EU officials: bottlenecks at every step of the process of accepting refugees

[Global Times Brussels correspondent Niu Ruifeng] According to Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration to make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.
The EU move is seen as a response to growing concern over illegal immigration in Europe, with the core issue being that only a small number of illegal immigrants can be deported.

According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external borders through infrastructure and monitoring measures.
However, the EU and its member states are still arguing over who should pay for the border wall.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But diplomats from some member states said that if the EU could shoulder part of the cost of installing cameras, observation towers and other infrastructure along the external border, it would help speed up the construction process by freeing up national budgets.

The European Euractiv website said that EU officials admitted that there were bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, limited reception capacity and overwhelmed immigration authorities in member states could not prevent refugees from submitting "endless" asylum applications to EU countries, and the EU refugee reception system was in a "near permanent crisis".
According to the European Union Commission, 920,000 asylum applications were received by the EU member states last year, an increase of nearly half compared with the previous year.
At the same time, the European Union recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.
Against this background, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle", namely that EU countries can return illegal immigrants to another member state based on the latter's court judgment.
In addition, the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of security countries", which will open the way for the EU to form a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifeng)

The first batch of personal pension insurance financial products is on sale, with the shortest holding period of 360 days - China News
The first batch of individual pension financial products goes on sale
7 kinds of products can be selected, the shortest holding period is 360 days
The personal pension product finally went online.

On February 10, China Financial Network released the first batch of personal pension financial product list, and the seven personal pension financial products of China Construction Bank Financial, Agricultural Bank of China Financial and China Postal Savings Bank Financial were officially launched.

At this point, the "warehouse" of personal pension account has finally gathered personal pension savings, personal pension financial management, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund four types of products.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension financial products are all public offerings of clean value type open-end products, of which there are 5 new products and 2 long-term products. Except for one mixed product, the other 6 products are all fixed income products.

Reporters from Beijing Youth Daily saw that of the 5 new products, 4 were from the Bank of Communications’ wealth management department, all of which were fixed income products, with the shortest holding period being 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) being 3.70%-4.20%, 4.10%-

The remaining new product is "Postal Finance Wealth Addition - Hengjin Shortest 1095 Days 1st Product", which is also a fixed income product, and the fundraising started on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is II.

Among the two continuous products, one is the agricultural bank financial product "Agricultural Bank Heart·Flexible" 360-day technological innovation RMB financial product, which is a hybrid investment product with risk level of level III.

Another continuous product is "Postal Savings Bank of China's Wealth Addition Hengjin No. 1, with a minimum holding period of 365 days", which is a fixed income type. It started to collect funds on December 30 last year and officially started to operate on January 4 this year. The accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension Funds", the financial products that can be invested with the funds in personal pension fund accounts include bank financial management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, public funds, etc.
The first batch of individual pension financial products was sold, marking that the investor of individual pension can buy financial products through the individual pension capital account.
The CBIRC issued the Temporary Measures for the Administration of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Wealth Management Companies in November last year.

The Regulations stipulate that the participants can purchase personal pension products, such as personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products, through their personal pension fund accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxes issued a notice, clarifying that the pension system for individuals will be launched and implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang in Hebei Province, Xiong'an New Area, and Yincheng in Shanxi Province.

By the end of 2022, the number of people participating in the individual pension insurance was 19.54 million, the number of people paying premiums was 6.13 million, and the total premiums paid were RMB 14.2 billion.
Previously, only the participating banks had listed personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension fund public offerings.
Now that personal pension products have gathered, how should investors choose?

A specialist from the Bank of Communications’ financial product research department said that compared with other personal pension products, the trial stage of pension financial products and personal pension financial products have three features in common.
First, stability, the risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept are more stable, and non-parent third-party independent custody is implemented.

The second is long-term, the trial period of pension financial products is generally 5 years or more, and the next personal pension financial products, the minimum holding period is generally 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold for 3 years or more.

The third is the inclusiveness. The threshold for purchasing the product is low, and the purchase point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The rate of storage fees, management fees, and other fees is more favorable.
Experts say investors should choose products based on their features and risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of longer term, higher interest rates and higher security, which are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on security, which are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; while personal pension financial products and public fund products are not guaranteed to return the principal or interest, but the expected return is relatively high, which are more suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and strong risk tolerance.
Written by: Cheng Jie, Reporter: Cheng Jie, Director: Chi Bo
Fitness Industry Should Overcome Trust Crisis - China News
Another large fitness club "bolt from the blue"?
Recently, the issue of the rights of members of the fitness club Jianjian, a well-known fitness club, has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally, and rumors about the bankruptcy and flight of the organization caused panic, leading to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization came forward to respond and promised to make efforts to protect the legal rights and interests of employees and members, and the storm was finally calmed down.

Some branches of individual fitness institutions have encountered business problems and temporarily closed, and consumers can calmly wait for the problem to be solved. Why is the first reaction of many members "something is wrong"?
Behind the storm of fitness club members’ rights protection, there is a deep-rooted problem of trust crisis in the industry.
Traditional fitness clubs in China generally adopt the pre-paid fee model, and “earning money from customers who don’t come” is the underlying logic of their development.

Through pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, and continuously opening new stores, it seems to be able to form a cycle, but in fact it is a case of "eating the rice of others", and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
Negative information about gyms and other industries is frequently released, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, gym is undoubtedly a good business with “money-making potential”.
The fitness race, although it fluctuates, is always paid attention to by capital.
A number of data show that the heat in the field of cultural consumption continues to rise, and the market continues to warm up.

Specifically, in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards, the concept of healthy life has become increasingly popular, and the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation, the more important it is to develop quality.

However, individual institutions have a blind optimism about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, and they are blowing the horn of expanding territory and opening new stores, and they are pouring all the financing resources into the construction of new stores.

It cannot be denied that many organizations have left due to the epidemic, the industry has been reshuffled, and some enterprises with strength have selectively increased their acquisition strength and restructuring, which is a new opportunity.

However, the fitness market development must enter a virtuous circle, and move up the stable and far-reaching health road, the industry must change the traditional mode, and change the operating strategy.
Only by stabilizing and consolidating, re-establishing consumer trust and security, can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with the fierce competition of opening new stores, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and stabilizing users with high-quality development.
First, you need to retain users through service.
Fitness clubs belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to "user-oriented", focus on the needs of users, and put the focus on service quality upgrades.
Second, digital transformation is necessary to improve user experience.
For example, the popular Internet fitness club model can realize users pay by times and choose the place.
At the same time, body data and motion data can be effectively utilized and meet social needs, and can realize the complete service loop from online to offline.
Without personal trainers and annual memberships, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness centers have been reduced, and trust has been improved.
In addition, we should actively explore multiple business models.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are likely to become new consumption channels, and the surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment or will become new profit points, and will provide consumers with more choices.

The decline of plastic rubber and its products, and optical equipment, was the most significant, with a year-on-year decline of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
Exports of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decrease in 11 years.
Among them, the integrated circuit industry fell by 18.3% year-on-year, the largest decline in the past 14 years.
Cai Meina, the director of the statistics department, said that this shows that the demand for consumer electronics is weakening, and the electronics industry is entering the adjustment period.
According to statistics, the import and export of Taiwan region in January decreased by 23.4 billion U.S. dollars, which is the lowest level in the past three years.

The financial management department of the Taiwan government believes that the global terminal demand has decreased, the industry adjustment of inventory has suppressed the willingness of merchants to purchase raw materials, and the export situation is very poor in the short term, and the export decline in the first quarter of Taiwan this year may be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwan Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research, the Taiwan manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for January was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, which was 3.3 percentage points lower than that of December last year, and continued to shrink for the seventh consecutive month.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is the threshold line of 50%, and the index above 50% represents expansion, and the index below 50% represents contraction.
In January, the five components of the Taiwan PMI were tightened, with new orders, production and employment tightened, supplier delivery time fell, and inventory tightened.

All six industries reported a narrowing PMI, with the order of narrowing being power and machinery equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optoelectronic industry (35.2%), chemical and biotechnology and medical industry (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industry (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the “Department of Budget, Accounting and Statistics” of the Taiwan government announced that the annual increase of the CPI in Taiwan in January was 3.04%, which broke the 3% again since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables increased by 28.25%, creating a new high in the past 17 months.

Cao Zhihong, a special commissioner of the "Taiwan Ministry of Finance", admitted that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed greater than expected. Excluding the Spring Festival factor, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking forward to Taiwan's economy this year, based on the reports of "United Daily News" and "Yahoo Finance" and other local media, experts are pessimistic.

Wu Da Ren, professor of economics at the Central University of Taiwan, analyzed that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturing enterprises, and the risk of debt default will rise.
At the same time, the reduction of orders led to the reduction of labor costs for enterprises, affecting the labor market and family economy, and in turn affecting consumption capacity.

According to the researcher of Taiwan Institute of Economic Research Qu Dashan, the inflation situation in Europe and America has not been resolved, and the demand continues to shrink, and the estimated export decline in Taiwan will continue until the first half of the year.
Due to the fact that Taiwan’s economy relies on exports and is affected by the export downturn, the annual economic growth will not be as good as last year.

The top 10 countries for returning students seeking employment in 2022 - Source: "2022 China Returning Students Employment Survey Report"

Beijing, February 11 (door.com.cn) (by Ren Wei) The recently published 2022 China Sea Returnees Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the “report”) shows that the number of graduating international students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of returning students seeking employment reached a new high, indicating that the demand for overseas talent in Chinese enterprises is also
The report pointed out that the number of returning home for employment in China has significantly increased since 2020, and the number of graduating students seeking employment has increased.
Compared with 2021, the number of students studying abroad in 2022 increased by 8.6%, and the number of students returning to seek employment after studying abroad reached a new high.

According to the distribution of countries where students returning to their home countries for employment studied abroad, the UK has the highest proportion, accounting for 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which is consistent with 2021.

From the perspective of year-on-year growth, the number of applicants for overseas study from Malaysia, Japan, and Singapore in 2022 increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9%, and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of prospective international students from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia has decreased compared to last year.
The first week of the Chinese New Year in 2023 will be the first week of the tide of returning talents. Source: 2022 China Returnees Employment Survey Report

According to the survey, 58% of the students who decided to return to China thought that "life in China is more convenient", 40% decided to return to China because they "feel more at home in the Chinese culture", 32% thought that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% thought that "the economic recovery in China will be accelerated, and there will be more job opportunities".
Data shows that the demand for foreign talents from domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for returning talents is on the rise.

The number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking employment in the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023 both showed an upward trend. The number of priority positions for returning overseas Chinese on February 3 was 11% higher than that on January 28, and the number of returning overseas Chinese seeking employment increased by 27%.

According to industry, in the 2022 priority positions for returning overseas talents, positions from the education/training industry accounted for 27.8%, ranking first, followed by professional services/consulting and the Internet/e-commerce industry, which accounted for 14.3% and 11.1% respectively.
The number of returning overseas Chinese seeking employment in China in recent years - Source: 2022 China Returned Overseas Chinese Employment Survey Report

From the salary, the average recruitment salary of the priority position of returning to the sea has been rising for three consecutive years, and reached 14,680 yuan/month (RMB, the same below) in 2022, which is 961 yuan higher than 13,719 yuan/month in 2021, and increased by 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the intention of the returning overseas Chinese to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities, and third- and lower-tier cities in 2022 has increased, and the proportion of investment was 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3%, respectively, all of which were higher than the proportion of investment in 2021.
For the yield of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said it basically met their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from last year (49.9%).
Twenty-eight-point-two percent of returnees said they were better off than expected, a proportion that was also higher than the 25.4 percent in 2021.

Shenzhen: Building the first and world-leading high-speed frontier city in China - ChinaNews.com

ChinaNews.com, February 11 -- According to the "Shenzhen Industrial and Information Technology" WeChat public account on February 10, the Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology of Shenzhen recently issued the "Shenzhen Rapid Pioneer Urban Construction Action Plan".

Among them, it is proposed to build a high-speed, large-capacity, and low-latency super broadband network by the end of 2023, and achieve the goal of "double Gigabit, full optical fiber, 1 millisecond, and everything connected", and build the first and leading super-fast leading city in the country and the world.
The Plan proposes to speed up the upgrade of 1000Mbps broadband.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires a comprehensive improvement in the energy efficiency of 5G networks.
The research is to establish the standard of Shenzhen 5G network service quality, carry out the test and evaluation of 5G network, and improve the quality of 5G network service.

It supports the telecommunications giants to increase the optimization degree of 5G networks in key areas and places, and adds 10,000 new 5G base stations throughout the year, with the average download speed in the city reaching 500Mbps and the upload speed reaching 100Mbps. The download speed in key areas reaches 1000Mbps and the upload speed reaches 200Mbps,
Building a city-level high-quality wireless LAN.

The public wireless local area network (WLAN) service standard is formulated, and the upgrading of WLAN in densely populated and information consumption areas is promoted to provide 1000Mbps access ability.

The "Deepi Network" will build a unified certification and management platform for the city's public wireless local area network, and realize "one-time certification, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching", and support the operating subject to include the social self-built AP (wireless access point) with public service capabilities in the certification management platform.
The number of upgraded access points will reach more than 20,000 by the end of 2023.

In addition, the Plan also proposes to build high-quality all-optical power networks, construct multi-level computing power supply systems, speed up the construction of key communication networks, and enhance the ability of Internet application services.
The plan clearly states that the parties will collaborate to build a sensing system.

Explore the construction of the terminal management mode based on the "open source Huawei Mongoose" operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, and accelerate the construction of city-level IoT perception platforms, promote the construction of regional IoT platforms, specialized IoT platforms, networks, and data interconnection.

Deepen the application of IoT perception in urban management, public services, public security, transportation and other fields, expand the fixed perception and intelligent network of vehicles, and collect mobile perception channels such as urban roads, buildings, and public facilities.

By the end of 2023, the number of smart terminals of water, electricity and gas Internet of Things (IoT) perception will exceed 9 million, and 20 or more multi-functional smart lampposts application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentions strengthening the integration of satellite and ground communications, building the basic facilities of low-altitude networks, and promoting the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.

At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of marine 5G networks, build an ecosystem for industrial innovation and development, and support the holding of top-level competitions and activities.
(China News Finance)
E-commerce in China is facing a new variable. How can delivery services be “content-oriented”?
-chinanews.com
China News Service, February 11, 2019: Title: "New Variables" in China's E-commerce Industry: How to Make Delivery "King of Content"?
Xia Bin, reporter of China News Finance
"We entered the e-commerce industry a bit late, but we knew from the start that in order to stand out from the millions of stores, content is very important.
"Guangdong 90s generation" girl Fangfang, who now runs a supplementary food store on Douyin, helps a 30-year-old offline store to "bloom online".
The video, which mimics the style of old Hong Kong movies and features classic Cantonese songs, was posted on @芳芳一人食 Douyin account, and the beautiful video is a fresh surprise.

In the recent "Find Peers·Quality Content Sharing Special" of TikTok e-commerce, Fangfang, as a representative of quality content creators, attended the meeting and spoke about her experience and feelings of daily creation.

She said on the spot: "The video that was carefully edited attracted a lot of attention from netizens, many people were interested in my family's ingredients, and they wanted to make delicious food together, and the road was suddenly opened.
Fang Fang has sold up to 300,000 supplementary food ingredients through live streaming, and has saved a family-owned store that was on the verge of closing.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short video and live broadcast e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live delivery, the price advantage was the only selling point in the live room.

In recent years, there are many well-known Vs such as Liu Zhiming and Dongfang Zhuanxuan, and many experts and merchants in the vertical field that are not well known to the public. They have continuously created high-quality content that fits their brand personality, and thus improved their long-term operating benefits.

High Yi, the operator of Douyin e-commerce star author, introduced that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into Douyin e-commerce, and the number of their content creation has increased by 252%, and the total transaction amount has doubled.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a vibrant and thriving author ecosystem.
"Gao Yiran said."

Beijing Normal University Communication Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform has previously published the "E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report", which analyzed the importance of the "new variable" of high-quality content in the current e-commerce industry from the data dimension, and used the index to evaluate the content ecosystem situation of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the report, the e-commerce industry content ecological health index ranking is: Douyin e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, JD.com.

The report believes that the e-commerce content ecology is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional produced content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers that can be integrated with e-commerce, and the higher the value of the content platform, the richer the scene of consumption and promotion, and the higher the possibility of e-commerce

At the scene, Professor Yim Guoming, the chairman of the Council of the China Media Economy and Management Specialty Committee of Beijing Normal University School of Journalism and Communication, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has already moved from the stage of “consumption convenience” to the stage of “consumption quality”, and high-quality, specialized and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the foundation and key to the development of e-commerce in the new stage, and knowledge-based content, professional knowledge, and KOL (key opinion leader) have become standard configurations in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking to the future development of e-commerce industry, Yim Guoming made two suggestions from two aspects.

One is from the perspective of the improvement of the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology, to build a positive standard for content creation and management, and realize the dynamic balance of the e-commerce industry content ecology health index.
Another is from the perspective of the external ecology, to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value co-creation with the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry will still need more data and support from artificial intelligence to make predictions about future stability; in addition, it will provide a more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, so that the value of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry can be coordinated, and a healthy content ecology can be created.

Chinese rescue team continues to carry out rescue operations in Turkey, rescued 4 people - China News

Xinhua News Agency, February 11th, According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on the 11th, on February 10th, the Chinese rescue team, which was in Turkey for rescue, dispatched 3 mobile teams and 45 rescue personnel, and rescued 1 person.
Two search evaluation teams were dispatched to assess and search 15 buildings on Wodabash Street.
As of now, 4 people have been rescued, 5 people have been found, and 25 severely damaged buildings have been searched for life signs and risk assessment.
The rescue team will scientifically adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation of the disaster area and the rescue site, and continue to carry out rescue work in depth.

The rescue team obtained the rescue appeal information through various channels such as embassies, local governments, and United Nations rescue organizations, and verified it through online inquiry, on-site search, and other means.
The Hong Kong Rescue Team introduced the current rescue environment and the building collapse situation to the Chinese Rescue Team, and they jointly conducted search operations.

At present, the rescue team is working with the Italian rescue team to coordinate the regional rescue work (SSC5), and 3 members of the team are participating in the work of the 5th regional rescue coordination center, communicating with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovak, Oman and other rescue teams to understand the situation of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team guarantee, and in accordance with the principle of "unity of command and safety first", strengthened the safety control of the rescue site, strengthened the discipline requirements of rescue work, and clarified the safety precautions.
Continuously operate the shift duty and sentry duty system, and strengthen the safety management of the camp.

The rescue team medical personnel provide daily health services to the team members, strengthen the medical security of key personnel, and all members of the rescue team are currently healthy, and the camp is being cleared.

After the self-built site was established, the logistics support personnel built 4 categories and 26 tents of battlefield account, including command and communication, equipment storage, medical washing, living and accommodation, and doghouse, to ensure the on-site rescue equipment for more than 30 sets.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) On Friday, February 10, the Biden government will blacklist six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the suspected espionage balloon plan.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute help the Chinese military to modernize, especially the aerospace projects, including ships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.
The list is called the "entity list," and companies on it are barred from buying technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they get a special export license from the Commerce Department.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Space Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Dongguan Lingshan Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Tianma Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xing Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Tianma Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
Before that, the White House said it was considering taking broader measures to "expose and deal with" China's larger surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has further strained the US-China relationship, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down the balloon, and the Chinese government made a serious protest to the U.S. Embassy in China, condemning the United States for seriously violating and damaging the efforts and progress of stabilizing Sino-US relations.

According to the existing evidence of the wreckage and the information of the Chinese military procurement platform, the U.S. government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

On Friday, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said at a press conference that regarding the accident that a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle entered the US airspace by mistake due to force majeure, the Chinese side had repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolutions of the US Congress were purely political manipulation and propaganda.
China is strongly dissatisfied with and firmly opposed to this.

Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce for export enforcement, said that the action today shows that the joint efforts to find and prevent China from using the espionage balloons that violated the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries have been successful.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhai Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he was not aware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States has not commented on the information.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) It has been several days since the earthquake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is gradually fading, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought great joy to the rescuers.

According to the Associated Press, the family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in Nurdağı, a town in Gaziantep Province, which was hit hard by the earthquake.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the rubble, followed by the father, who insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
After everyone was rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were rescued in freezing conditions.
"What day is it today?
"---the boy who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asked the rescue workers who pulled him out of the ground.
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his cat that was just rescued
The success stories of miraculous rescue have brought a glimmer of hope to the otherwise hopeless rescue work, but at the same time, the number of people who have been stranded has been increasing.
According to the official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey and more than 3,500 deaths in neighboring Syria.
Although experts say people can survive for more than a week after being trapped in rubble, hope of finding more survivors is fading.
Rescue workers were still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, rescue efforts are shifting to help those who are in dire need of assistance.
UN official: 'Century-level' disaster in Haiti

Martin Griffiths, the UN under-secretary-general for humanitarian affairs and emergency relief coordinator, said at a press conference in Turkey that the earthquake was "the worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's "unusual" response to the disaster.
He also told Reuters that he hoped to provide aid to both government and opposition-controlled areas in Syria, but said that the situation was "not clear."
The United Nations pledged an additional $25 million in aid to the Syrian earthquake victims.
Earlier this week, the UN announced $25 million in aid for Turkey and Syria.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Chilean Earthquake (1960)
At 15:11 on May 22, 1960 (local time), the largest earthquake ever recorded in human history occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a seismic moment of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The massive tsunami caused by the earthquake hit the Chilean coastline, with waves up to 25 meters high.
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Alaska Earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and it was Good Friday.
The largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, USA, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in the world since records began.
During the earthquake, a fracture in the boundary between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near the entrance of College Fjord in Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The seabed displacement triggered a tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Schools and many businesses were closed because it was a holiday.
The earthquake finally killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while 130 others died from the tsunami caused by the earthquake.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, Tangshan, Hebei Province, and Pingnan County, Guangdong Province, China, were hit by two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above within 16 hours.
The epicenter is 23 kilometers deep.
The entire traffic, communication, water supply and electricity of Tangshan City were cut off, and the city was flattened at once.
Beijing, the capital city 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to the official statistics, a total of 242,769 people died and 164,851 people were seriously injured in the disaster-stricken areas including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in China's history, second only to the Shaanxi earthquake in 1556.
But foreign scientists estimate that the earthquake may cause at least 650,000 deaths.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)

On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred in the western coast of Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia, 160 kilometers away from the coast. The depth of the earthquake was 30 kilometers, and the magnitude was 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 feet.
The 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the hardest hit areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Phuket and Pattaya in Thailand, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

The disaster struck during the peak holiday season for Christmas, with many tourists and locals in the affected areas, resulting in many tourists on the beach and locals working along the coast being swept away by the tsunami, making the earthquake a major cause of missing persons.
At least 300,000 people were killed or went missing, according to estimates.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a large earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data from the China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2, and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the area of destruction exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

Up to September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 69227 deaths, 17923 missing persons, 374643 injuries of varying degrees, 19.93 million people homeless, and a total population affected by the disaster of 46.256 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualty after the earthquake in Tangshan.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as National Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, in order to strengthen the education of the public and pay more attention to disaster prevention and reduction.
After that, many governments and schools in China hold earthquake drills every year on this day.
Primary and secondary schools have also begun to attach importance to popularizing “disaster reduction and mitigation” education.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurred in the Caribbean Sea.
The epicenter of the earthquake is located 25 kilometers to the southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the depth of the earthquake is about 13 kilometers.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The confirmed death toll released by the Haitian government exceeded 200,000.
In some areas of Haiti, as many as 90 percent of the homes were destroyed.
Although the international community has provided a great deal of aid and support, this country with a surplus population of corruption has never recovered from this disaster.
The 10 most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
On March 11, 2011, a megathrust earthquake with a moment magnitude of 9.0 occurred in the outer sea of Tohoku region, Japan.

The earthquake occurred in the Pacific Ocean to the east of the capital city of Miyagi Prefecture, Sendai, and its depth was measured at 24,000 meters, triggering a massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
It was the first earthquake in Japan's recorded history to have a magnitude of more than 9.
About 22,000 people died and about 40,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima No. 1 Nuclear Power Plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, causing a leakage accident.
The accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
the Fukushima nuclear accident led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive materials around the world , including iodine-131 and caesium-137 ( with a half @-@ life of 30 years ) .
large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the two countries affected by the drought need food aid.
In Syria alone, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes to earthquakes.
The World Food Program (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food to people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area is now below zero, and many of the victims have no place to live.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but the aid still hasn't reached many of those in desperate need.
In Syria, where the war has been raging for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the suffering of the people.
The World Food Programme has already provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria in the four days since the earthquake.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of external injuries and emergency surgery.
