Google AI chatbot "answers wrong questions" and parent company's stock evaporates $100 billion
(Compiled on November 11)

Google's newly launched artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has been a disaster, as it "answered questions incorrectly" in a promotional video, causing the parent company Alphabet's stock to plummet by 8.9% on Tuesday, breaking the $1,000 barrier, and wiping out $110 billion (about 476.5 billion yuan) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet won't be able to compete with Microsoft.

According to Reuters, Google released a promotional video of its AI chatbot Bard earlier on social media, in which someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?
"Bard mentioned in his answer that this telescope had taken the first picture of an exoplanet.

However, according to the data from the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of exoplanets was taken by the "Extremely Large Telescope" of European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters reported the incident as "Alphabet's stock plunges after Bard's wrong answer".

On the other hand, Google said that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing," and that it will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards of quality, safety, and truthfulness."
Singapore's tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists growing 19 times that of 2021

(Compiled on 11th) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 is expected to reach between 12 million and 14 million, bringing in approximately SGD18 billion to SGD21 billion in tourism revenue; the number of tourists and tourism revenue are expected to recover to approximately 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2
Singapore's tourism market gradually restarted and recovered in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased by 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the earlier estimate of 400,000 to 600,000, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore's tourism revenue was 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it was expected that the tourism revenue of the whole year would reach 13.8-14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which was 6-7 times that of 1.89 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and had already recovered to about 50%-52% of the level before the COVID-
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to speed up the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly 500 million yuan to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The Tourism Bureau announced recently that it plans to allocate 110 million yuan from this budget in the next two years to promote more business and leisure activities to attract tourists back.

In order to make health and wellness a highlight of tourism in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board (STB) has launched a public consultation on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Liling, the director of the sports and health tourism division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their considerations.

Developing a healthy living site in Marina South, which is home to Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to the tourism and economy of Singapore, and keep tourists in Singapore for longer periods of time.
Chen Byong, the director of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Bureau has been promoting healthy living programs to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, providing more than 130 types of health activities and experiences for the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences to visitors.

Besides the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, Gardens by the Bay's Cloud Forest, Marina Bay Central: The Heart of Marina Bay, ArtScience Museum's Explore the Unknown exhibition hall, and Night Safari's open-air theatre, the tourism board will support the development and updating of projects such as the Jurong Bird Park, to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will establish industry standards for sustainable development of the meeting, exhibition and incentive travel industry by 2023, and focus on improving the two major issues of waste disposal and carbon emissions to further optimize the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated as the aviation industry recovers.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport has seen a strong recovery in passenger traffic, with daily passenger traffic reaching 15,000, weekly passenger traffic reaching 100,000, which is about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of aviation personnel has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the data, from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and the number of take-off and landing flights is 1.7 million, which is equivalent to 53% of the pre-pandemic period.
The tourism industry has recovered quickly, and has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

Cheng Su Dan, assistant director of the international division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that according to a survey by a Chinese travel platform, Singapore ranks among the top three in the world in terms of safety, which is one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the outbreak of the COVID-19, about 3.6 million Chinese tourists traveled to Singapore for vacation each year.
With China relaxing its border policy, the number of Chinese tourists is expected to recover to 30% to 60% of 2019 this year.
Keb Shu Dan pointed out that the next step, the tourism department will closely monitor the signals of further release of China's outbound travel policies to meet the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in line with the new trends in Chinese outbound tourism.

Looking forward to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is full of confidence, believing that as long as the global economy does not experience a significant decline in public income and there are no new large-scale deadly epidemics, the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected.

(Compiled on the 11th) North Korea held a military parade on the 8th to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army, and Kim Jong-un’s daughter, Kim Ju-ae, not only attended the event, but also stood on the podium with her father.

North Korean media released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Jong-un hugging his father, and exchanging warm looks and whispers several times. Kim Jong-un gently patted his father's face and even touched his father's chest. The father-son interaction was broadcasted nationwide.
However, the First Lady Ri Sol-ju could only stand by.

According to the reports of the Korean Central News Agency and other Korean media, Kim Jong-un and his wife Ri Sol-ju attended the banquet on the 7th with their daughter Kim Ju-ae, and in the official photo of the banquet, Kim Ju-ae sat between her parents in the C position, which is rare. The next day, on the 8th, during the military parade on the 75th anniversary of the founding of the Korean
The North Korean official media, the Korean Central Television, released a video of the military parade after the event, which showed more scenes of the father-son relationship.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times from the podium, and the two of them smiled at each other, whispering in each other's ear. Kim Jong-un once put his hands on his father's cheeks, and Kim Jong-un also smiled back.

Other state media images also showed Kim Jong-un's sister, Kim Yo-jong, touching her father's face as they sat on a sofa inside, and rubbing her father's chest as they walked, holding hands with her brother.

The sudden death of Zheng Yonggang, founder of Shengshi, due to a heart attack. He led the first transformation of China's clothing industry. - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website

Economic Observer reporter Zheng Yiyun, February 11, the official account of the WeChat public number of the Sanshan Group (hereinafter referred to as Sanshan Group) issued a notice of death. The founder and chairman of the board of Sanshan Group, Zheng Yonggang, died of sudden heart disease on February 10, 2023, at the age of 65.
In the 1980s, Zheng Yonggang served as the general manager of the state-owned cotton spinning mill, and was transferred to Ningbo Yunhai Clothing Co., Ltd., the predecessor of Sinopec, in 1989.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leaders Annual Meeting and the 22nd China Enterprise Future Star Annual Meeting, Zheng Yonggang said in his speech that the market share of Shanshan brand in the Chinese suit market in the 1990s reached 37%.

"Fund E-accounts" have arrived: Securities Regulatory Commission authorizes development to enable investors to consolidate and inquire about all their funds - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer, Chen Xian, the complexity of the fund purchase channel makes it difficult to collect account information?
Have you forgotten the "small treasure chest"?
These problems of the base will soon be solved.
On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the "Fund E-account" APP was listed on various mobile app stores and was in public beta testing.

According to the introduction, "Fund E-account" is a "one-stop" inquiry service for personal investors to provide the account and share information of public funds, which aims to solve the pain points of the industry service that many small and medium investors forget the account and the inquiry is complicated.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic fund management companies, with a total fund size of approximately 2.6 trillion yuan; 167 fund registration institutions for public funds, and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each quota registration institution account system is independent of each other, and there is no unified query channel for the industry.

According to some industry people, by the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in our country exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the population of the country invested in fund products.

Before, investors had to inquire about the purchase situation through different sales channels, but through the "Fund E-account", they can inquire about the purchase situation of all sales channels, and the holding situation of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E-account" APP is a mobile application developed and constructed with the approval of the China Securities Regulatory Commission for the public fund industry gateway, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the holding situation of the fund product outside the market for all public funds.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp their holdings of fund products of fund management companies outside the fund market through the "Fund E-account", which can comprehensively improve the efficiency of inquiry.

Specifically, investors can obtain the following information through the “Fund E-account”: the account information of the fund account opened by the fund management company in all the markets, the account information of the trading account opened by the sales agency of the fund, and the outside shareholding situation of the collective asset management product that does not have a limit of 200 investors, including the public offering securities investment fund and the securities company-managed investment fund.

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told Economic Observer that investors can know all their outside-the-exchange fund holdings through the "Fund E-Account" App, which helps them recover "forgotten assets". More importantly, it collects all the account information of the consolidated fund investment, helping investors to grasp their investment situation more timely, accurately and comprehensively, so as to optimize their fund
How do I register?

Reporters noticed that the "Fund E-account" APP has been listed in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, which can be obtained by contacting the fund manager of the fund held by the investor.

A customer service staff member of a large-scale public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the reporter of Economic Observer and said, “During the trial operation of the APP, China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, and investors can obtain them by calling the phone number. We will provide them.
After the trial run is over, you don't need an invitation code when you register.

The reporter downloaded and used the relevant documents of the user registration and use instructions of the "Fund E-Account" on the website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and completed the account registration and inquiry in a few minutes, which was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund inquiry.

After completing the real name authentication step, click the "asset" fund binding button, all fund products purchased by the reporter through the sales platform of each fund will be presented in the binding options list (can be bound to the account), and the binding will be completed, and the total assets invested in the fund will be displayed directly, and the query function can be used.
It is worth noting that the "fund E-account" only provides query services to investors, and cannot be redeemed or bought and sold.
The date of data displayed in "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days before the date of inquiry by the user (T day).

For example, when you open the "Fund E-account" on February 10, the total assets, the number of shares, and the net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before that date, i.e., February 7.

The All-China Federation of Trade Unions has called for a large-scale demonstration against the government's pension reform plan again
On Saturday (February 11), French unions called for a national mobilization against the government's pension reform bill, urging people to take to the streets and express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of social movements against the government's pension system reform bill.
The number of people who respond to the call to gather could influence the next steps of the labor union.
It is the fourth time that the eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a national mobilization in a month, and the first time that the protest has been scheduled for Saturday.
Given that most French people have the day off on Saturdays, they don't have to choose between joining a protest or a strike, and unions hope that the rally will attract more people.

No unions representing bus, subway or public rail systems have called for a strike, meaning the systems should be able to operate normally, allowing people to get to protests and for those in areas where schools are starting winter break to travel.

The union hopes that more than a million people will attend the rally, while the police expect the national participation to be between 600,000 and 800,000, and the Paris region may gather 900,000 to 1.2 million people.

Since the anti-government pension reform movement began, although the polls show that the majority of French people do not support the measure of delaying the statutory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who really take to the streets to participate in the parade is gradually decreasing.
The first strike and demonstration on January 31 attracted 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters on Monday (February 7) was estimated to be between 757,000 and 2 million.
The pension reform bill is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition, especially in the opposition party led by the radical left, numerous amendment proposals were submitted, which slowed down the legislative process.
The conflict between the court and the government is also becoming more and more intense.

A radical left-wing French party, La France Insoumise, has sparked controversy after one of its MPs posted a picture of himself on social media with a balloon bearing the face of the Labour Minister, which has been criticised by the ruling party.

The Speaker of the National Assembly finally announced that the member of parliament was banned from participating in the activities of the National Assembly for 15 days as a punishment for this behavior.

Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social trend in France in the past 20 years, the government has only made some minor adjustments to the bill, but has not made any major concessions.
The union plans to launch another protest on Thursday, March 16, and had also planned a protest on March 7 when the reform bill was handed to the Senate for discussion.

Last communist leader of East Germany dies
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night, Hans Modrow (95 years old) left us.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On Nov. 13, 1989, just four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, dividing East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to step down because of protests for democracy and freedom in East Germany.
Gorbachev, who came to power in the Soviet Union, has called for reforms in Eastern Europe, which is under Soviet control.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic.
The election results forced him to resign as prime minister.
Though Mugabe has made reforms, opponents accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and unity that occurred in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, he was convicted of election fraud in the municipal elections of May 1989, but was not imprisoned.
Some have called the charges politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, he continued to serve in the German parliament and was a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrow saw himself as a reformer and wanted to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want the old East Germany back, but said it should be acknowledged for its achievements.
Modro was born in Jasenitz, a small town in Germany in 1928, and received mechanical engineering training.
During World War II, he was a youth firefighter and a member of the Nazi militia Volkssturm, which drafted men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
At 17, Modro was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war, where he took part in anti-fascist courses and became a committed communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found a job as a mechanic, while continuing to study social sciences and economics and earning a doctorate.
Modrow was a functionary in the Free German Youth, a movement almost all East Germans joined, and rose to head of the SED in Dresden from 1973 to 1989, when the party ruled.
He served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany and assumed the highest state office.

Sichuan Earthquake Relief and Recovery Programme

Rescue teams from more than 50 countries have been working around the clock to dig through the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings in Turkey and Syria, where a powerful earthquake struck the border region last week, burying survivors under tons of rubble.
At freezing temperatures, they often call for quiet, straining to hear any sign of life from the rubble.
Reuters reported today that two women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after several days.
But the death toll from the earthquake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has reported 20,665 deaths, and Syria more than 3,500.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria on Monday was the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the death toll from Japan's 2011 earthquake and tsunami and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by Iran's 2003 earthquake.
A similar strong earthquake occurred in northwestern Turkey in 1999, causing more than 17,000 deaths.
Turkish officials said Saturday that two women were rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in 20 years.
Another man, 55, was confirmed dead, Masallah Cicek, who was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold, rescuers often call for calm, because they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble.
In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescue workers crouch under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reach into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He squinted his eyes and carried the baby wrapped in a blanket to the field hospital.
Video footage shows the man's mother being carried away, with her head hanging low and her face pale, but she appeared to be conscious.

Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters in the early hours of Monday that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours and 31,000 rescue workers were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said about 80,000 people were in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless, crammed into temporary shelters.
The leaders of the two countries have been increasingly questioned by the public for their response to the disaster, as many people lack food in the cold winter.
Syrian state media said President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo with him, the first time he had visited a disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwestern Syria were running low due to the complexity of aid work in the conflict zone.
Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey on Friday and admitted that the government's response was not as quick as expected.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a May 14 vote that could be delayed by the disaster.
Reuters said that the anger of delaying aid and starting rescue work may affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the toughest challenge to Erdogan's rule in his 20-year tenure.
Erolan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative movements" for political purposes.
Kemal Kilicdaroglu, leader of Turkey's main opposition party, criticized the government's response.
Critics say the earthquake was bad, but the lack of coordination, planning and ability was worse.

What is the "object" that fell from the sky in Alaska?
guessing wildly, and in a state of confusion.
The U.S. military again deployed its most advanced stealthy gas-jet fighter, the F-22, on Friday afternoon to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky over Alaska.
The debris was found about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
It was the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an unmanned aerial vehicle.
A Chinese espionage balloon was shot down off the coast of South Carolina last Saturday, several days after it was spotted in the U.S. airspace.

The Pentagon said the second object, which entered U.S. airspace for the first time on Thursday evening while moving over northeastern Alaska, was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved through the sky at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also said there was no evidence that the object was controllable.

White House National Security Council strategic communications coordinator John Kirby said Friday that while the specifics of the object in the sky are not yet clear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of the airliner."
Kobe said that this object was different from the espionage balloon found in the United States, and it did not have a "payload" hanging on it.
"We call it an 'object' because that's the best way we can describe it," Kobe said.
Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the strike on the object, and he made the decision "very carefully," Kobe said.
The official description of this object in the US is roughly: the size of a small car, no control sticks, no suspension, and a flying height of about 10,000 meters.
But these data do not answer basic questions, such as what this object is, which country it belongs to, and what it is doing.
Many online analyses and guesses believe that this is another Chinese balloon.
It may be the same type of balloon that was used to spy on U.S. airspace and the Chinese balloon that was floating over Latin America, performing some task at different locations.
Some people have linked the Alaska "object" with the "unidentified flying object" (UFO).

The Newsweek report cited a tweet by former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer on Friday, in which he said, "I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is also an espionage balloon and not a legitimate UFO."
"The joke of mixing alien spacecraft with weather balloons is quite surprising, but it is not worth triggering an interstellar conflict," Meyer said.
Mejia tweeted this after Kobe confirmed that the object was dropped from the stands shortly after the incident.
Newsweek said that Mejia was not the only one who doubted the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's handling of the cover-up of information and called for the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on "unidentified aerial phenomena."

I read it a long time ago, but I just saw the review and thought I'd share my thoughts.
This book is not so much a collection of short stories as a collection of fragments of love in life.
The tone of the book is very calm, like the calmness of white water, the words and sentences are simple and concise, and the plot is also like the quiet and peaceful afternoon streets in summer.
Each short story is a clip of a mundane life, without a beginning or an end.
Collected together, the essays were named What We Talk About When We Talk About Love.

I think this collection of stories, and its title, is a kind of performance art, where the author is trying to express that love is not just the theatrical ups and downs of the city legend, the dried up sea and the crumbling stone, it is not just the glue that sticks you to me, and it is not just the former, and it should not be represented by the former, and it is also the quiet life of water, the tedious and
As you read this book , you may recall the bickering couples you've known , the unfulfilling marriages of friends , and the relationships that didn't work out as you'd hoped .

This is why I don’t recommend reading it, from a literary standpoint, the writing and plot are both bland, unless your life is as exciting as living in Candyland, otherwise, you will feel that it is strange and boring while reading.

And from a depth of thought, the daily events do not illuminate or expand the reader's mind and vision (unlike Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera), and the brief vignettes do not explore any issues, such as what kind of mistake led to the failure of love?
What was the cause of the protagonist's marital breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are more expressed through technique and tone than through plot, which is why the reading experience is less satisfying.
It's not suitable for reading in detail, but it's good for reading in a hurry.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not rich enough.
Explained many sales theories and why, but very weak in how to do it, only pointed to the direction but not give specific methods.
Also, the book felt cobbled together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign ones; there are both famous entrepreneurs or salesmen and those who are not well known but have a good reputation.
I don't know if the story was compiled for the sake of an example, but if some cases that the author had experienced were cited, it would be more convincing.
The title of the customer is changing.
The title is still customer, but the content has become customer.
There were also problems with misspelled words, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering in the e-book.
In short, this book is a good choice for a theoretical introduction, but it is not suitable for people who have already worked in sales and want to improve their sales skills.
A Quick Guide to Internet Finance: The Definitive Guide

This book is shallow, it can be said that it is just an introductory course, which can help everyone quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but if you want to understand it in depth, you still need to find the clues yourself and dig deeper.

And the book was published earlier, so it didn't mention the later Alipay WeChat supplementary war to cultivate user habits, and the third-party payment market share mentioned in the book is probably much smaller than it is now.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat just by bringing their mobile phones, and merchants also gave up UnionPay because of the high bank turnover.

However, I would like to thank the author for writing this introductory book. It is clear that the author has had many years of financial observation experience, and is familiar with the financial development history of both China and the world, so he can write such clear and easy-to-understand content.
It's easy to write high-level stuff, the hard part is writing it in plain English.
I love you, and I want you to know it!
The first factor in determining a person's job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether they are valued and recognized in their work.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after the basic needs of survival are met, the most urgent need is for psychological needs to be met - the need to be understood, approved, and recognized.
In fact, for the Chinese, most of them are "love you in the heart of the throat is difficult to open", even if they love, thank and praise are all in the heart, but will not say it.
In this book, the author explains the five love languages: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, gifts, and physical touch.

I don't think it's important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them spontaneously and sincerely to appreciate the people in your life, whether they are family, friends or colleagues.
The closer the people in our lives, the more we need to praise and thank them, and that makes our lives better.
If you learn to praise and reward, enterprises can also retain talents to a certain extent and reduce the turnover rate.

The worst shopping experience in history

On the evening of September 23, my wife's mobile phone was dropped, and I suddenly bought a 8P Amazon Prime from Malaysia. It was delivered but not self-operated and without additional charges (I was secretly happy). Because it was not self-operated, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the latest delivery was expected to be on September 27.

My wife didn't have a phone and died of suffering, she called me at 6:30 the next morning to think of a way, and then I saw that there was a 256G phone that could be delivered to Beijing the same day, so I had to order another one immediately.
I got a new one, so I wanted to cancel my Amazon order right away.

Because the order was placed at night, it was impossible to receive the express delivery in the morning, and I called the customer service at 7:30 to cancel the order, and the customer service replied that the order had been cancelled and was waiting for the SMS notification.

OK, I will wait patiently. I checked my phone at noon and found that the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted the customer service to cancel the order as soon as possible. The customer service replied that the operation was OK.

At 3pm I checked my phone and the order was still there, I couldn't do anything but call the customer service again to confirm that I was calling for the third time and to cancel the order and tell the seller not to ship!

The customer service representative contacted the seller at my request and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and would need to familiarize himself with the system before canceling the order.
But please know that the seller is aware and will not be shipping.
I checked my orders on Monday and it had already been shipped, I was speechless.
Because you can't contact the seller directly, you have to call the customer service again.
The handling behind was simple, I said one step, and the customer service just operated it.
The order is still in the status of delivery refused, and is preparing to be sent again!
Amazon won't follow up on its own?
The real estate company has already received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In summary, I will never pay in advance for a big project again, it's too troublesome.
